chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: Hello, how are you all? This is Lakshya.

chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: We are back with DBMX lecture no. 13.

chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: Today we are going to discuss a very important interview question.

chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: It is called How to implement Atomicity and Durability.

chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: Before discussing this, let's recap what is atomicity and durability.

chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: Atomicity is the atomic operation of a transaction.

chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: That means the transaction will either be completed or not.

chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: It will not be left in between.

chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: It is not like your money is deducted and then your money is lost or not returned.

chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: If it fails, it will be rolled back.

chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: you have told the system that the transaction has been completed,

chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: notified the user that it is completed,

chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: then whatever updates have been made in DB should persist.

chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: It should not happen that you have told the user that it is completed,

chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: but because of some failure in the DB,

chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: at the time of the transaction,

chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: when the transaction was being committed or after the transaction,

chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: the changes in the DB should be persistent and durable.

chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: It should not happen that the changes are fizzled out and lost.

chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: It should not happen like this.

chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: But how will we implement this thing?

chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: The most naive or easy way is shadow copy.

chunks.title: How to Implement Atomicity and Durability？, DBMS Interview question
chunks.text: Let's call it a shadow copy scheme.
